Key Match Events: Suryakumar Yadav hits unbeaten 50 to lead India to 111-3 with 10 balls to spare
Netravalkar removes Kohli for golden duck before dismissing Rohit
USA post 110-8: Nitish 27 (23); Arshdeep 4-9 - Siraj takes superb catch to dismiss Nitish
Shivam Dube hits two down the ground to seal the victory
Pre-Game Insights: India captain Rohit Sharma: 'We knew this was going to be a tough task. We lost some wickets up front but we showed some maturity to take the game to the end.'
USA captain Aaron Jones: 'I would say we were 10-15 runs short on that pitch. We knew that 125-130 would have been a tough total to chase but it goes that way sometimes.'
Post-Match Reflections: Player of the match Arshdeep Singh: 'I'm very, very happy with the performance. In the last two games I gave away a little more runs, so I wasn't happy with that. The team always believed in me and kept backing me, so I had to deliver for them.'
Daniel Norcross: 'It was never in doubt that India would reach the Super 8s, but they have been taken close by this USA side. They put in a sterling performance.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: The official attendance today is 31,219. That's the second biggest crowd we've had at this ground during the tournament.
India join Australia and South Africa in qualifying for the next stage, which was expected from all three.
